comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Albert Burnley Bibb (b. 1853) was a professor of architecture, teaching at Catholic University (he's listed on the faculty in their 1915 bulletin). See Albert Burnley Bibb, "The Gardens and Grounds of Mount Vernon, Virginia," in Charles Francis Osborne, Historic Houses and their Gardens (J. F. Winston, 1908). He seems to have designed many life-saving stations for the Coast Guard in the 1890s: www.uscg.mil/tcyorktown/ops/nmlbs/Surf/surf5.asp www.nps.gov/nr/travel/maritime/poi.htm www.nps.gov/maritime/park/slbelss.htm capemaykiwanis.com/History.html en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Klipsan_Beach_Life_Saving_Station www.arcadiami.com/Exhibits/Shipwrecks/shipwrecksUSLSS.htm
